key_myths.title: Birth from Izanagi's Purification
key_myths.summary: • After fleeing the underworld realm of Yomi, Izanagi purified himself in a river. As he washed his left eye, the sublime radiance of Amaterasu was born. She emerged fully formed, her brilliance so overwhelming that Izanagi immediately recognized her supremacy and bestowed upon her the rule of Takamagahara - the High Plain of Heaven. This birth through purification (misogi) establishes her as the embodiment of purity itself.

key_myths.title: The Cave of Heaven (Ama-no-Iwato)
key_myths.summary: • The most celebrated myth tells of Amaterasu's retreat into a cave. Enraged by Susanoo's destructive rampage in her realm - where he defiled her weaving hall, destroyed rice paddies, and killed one of her attendants with a flayed horse - Amaterasu sealed herself within the Heavenly Rock Cave. The world plunged into eternal darkness. The eight million kami gathered in desperate council. The cunning goddess Ame-no-Uzume performed an ecstatic, ribald dance that caused such divine laughter that Amaterasu's curiosity was piqued. When she opened the cave to peek, the kami Ame-no-Tajikarao pulled her out, and a sacred rope (shimenawa) was placed across the entrance to prevent her return. Light returned to the world, and this myth explains the origins of sacred dance (kagura) and many Shinto purification rituals.

key_myths.title: The Divine Mandate to Earth
key_myths.summary: • Amaterasu sent her grandson Ninigi-no-Mikoto to pacify and rule the terrestrial realm. She bestowed upon him the Three Sacred Treasures (Sanshu no Jingi): the mirror Yata no Kagami ("so that you may see me within it"), the sword Kusanagi, and the jewels Yasakani no Magatama. These treasures became the Imperial Regalia, validating the divine authority of every Japanese emperor as Amaterasu's descendant.

key_myths.title: The Conflict with Susanoo
key_myths.summary: • Before his banishment, Susanoo challenged Amaterasu to a contest of creation. Each deity used the other's possessions to create offspring - Amaterasu chewed Susanoo's sword and breathed forth five male deities; Susanoo used her jewels to create three female goddesses. Amaterasu declared victory because the males came from her breath, but Susanoo's subsequent violence showed his rejection of civilized divine order.

mythology_stories.sources: Sources:Kojiki(Record of Ancient Matters, 712 CE),Nihon Shoki(Chronicles of Japan, 720 CE),Kogo Shui(Gleanings from Ancient Stories),Engishiki(Procedures of the Engi Era)

family.father: • Izanagi-no-Mikoto - The male creator deity who gave birth to her through purification
family.mother: • Born not from Izanami but from Izanagi's left eye during his misogi purification rite
family.brothers: • Tsukuyomi-no-Mikoto (Moon God, born from right eye), Susanoo-no-Mikoto (Storm God, born from nose)
family.children by contest: • Five male kami created from Susanoo's sword - including Ame-no-Oshihomimi, ancestor of the Imperial line
family.grandson: • Ninigi-no-Mikoto - sent to rule Earth, great-grandfather of first Emperor Jimmu
